background: An amusement park is installing ticket machines, both cash-based and card-only machines.
constraints: Number of cash-based machines is an integer
Number of card-only machines is an integer
Number of cash-based machines is non-negative
Number of card-only machines is non-negative
Processing rate of cash-based machines is at least RateCash people per hour per machine
Processing rate of card-only machines is at least RateCard people per hour per machine
Total processing rate is at least MinPeople people per hour
Cash-based machines use PaperCash rolls of paper per hour per machine
Card-only machines use PaperCard rolls of paper per hour per machine
Total paper usage is at most MaxPaper rolls of paper per hour
Number of card-only machines does not exceed the number of cash-based machines
objective: Minimize the total number of machines in the park
description: An amusement park is installing ticket machines, both cash-based and card-only machines. A cash-based machine can process \var{RateCash} people per hour while a card-only machine can process \var{RateCard} people per hour. The cash-based machine needs \var{PaperCash} rolls of paper per hour while the card-only machine requires \var{PaperCard} rolls of paper per hour. The amusement park needs to be able to process at least \var{MinPeople} people per hour but can use at most \var{MaxPaper} rolls of paper per hour. Since most people prefer to pay by cash, the number of card-only machines must not exceed the number of cash-based machines. How many of each machine should be bought to minimize the total number of machines in the park?

parameters.definition: Processing rate of a cash-based machine (people per hour)
Processing rate of a card-only machine (people per hour)
Paper rolls needed per hour by a cash-based machine
Paper rolls needed per hour by a card-only machine
Minimum total processing capacity required (people per hour)
Maximum total paper rolls allowed per hour
